name: potato
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 a round vegetable that grows underground and has white flesh with light brown, red, or pink skin, or the plant on which these grow: boiled/roasted/fried potatoes mashed potato/mashed potatoes
Tastyart Ltd Rob White/ Photolibrary/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesA traditional British main course consists of a meat dish with potatoes and other vegetables.Could you peel the potatoes for me, please?I had a baked potato for lunch, which was very filling.Chips are made of potato - surely you know that!Mash the potatoes and then mix in the butter and herbs.

a white vegetable with a brown or reddish skin which grows underground and is used for food, or the plant on which this grows: [ C ] a baked potato [ U ] mashed potato
